text.tspan: Death rates from indoor air pollution vs. share of population in absolute
Age-standardized death rates from illness attributed to household air pollution from solid cooking fuels, measured per 100,000
individuals versus the share of the total population in absolute poverty (which is defined by a $1.90 poverty line corrected for
Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day (2011 PPP) (% of population)
Death rates from indoor air pollution (per 100,000)
Source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME); World Bank - World Development Indicators
